articles.description: James Maddison scores twice as Tottenham romp to victory over a Manchester City side that has now lost five games in a row for the first time since 2006.
articles.title: James Maddison scored twice as Tottenham romped to victory over a Manchester City side that has now lost five games in a row for the first time since 2006.

articles.description: Wales slump to a 12th loss in a row as the Springboks end their season on high.
articles.title: Wales 12-45 South Africa: Dominant Springboks inflict 12th Wales loss in row

articles.description: Listen to Sportsound commentary and follow live text updates as Hearts welcome Celtic in the Scottish Premiership.
articles.title: Hearts vs Celtic: Scottish Premiership - BBC Sport

articles.description: Ethan Nwaneri is the second-youngest player to score a Premier League goal for Arsenal, behind only Cesc Fabregas - but Mikel Arteta explains why he must stay patient.
articles.title: Ethan Nwaneri: Arsenal's 17-year-old goalscorer is an 'extra special' talent

articles.description: Andy Murray will coach his long-time former rival Novak Djokovic at the Australian Open in 2025.
articles.title: Australian Open 2025: Andy Murray to coach Novak Djokovic at tournament

articles.description: Follow live text commentary, score updates and match stats from Celta Vigo vs Barcelona in the Spanish La Liga
articles.title: Celta Vigo vs Barcelona: Spanish La Liga - BBC Sport

articles.description: Scotland have long been capable of flashes of brilliance, but now they need a winning performance when Australia visit, writes Tom English.
articles.title: Scotland v Australia: 'Time for Townsend's side to deliver result, not moments'

articles.description: Ireland head coach Andy Farrell is encouraged by how his much-changed side "controlled the game" in their 52-17 win over Fiji.
articles.title: Ireland 52-17 Fiji: Ireland head coach Andy Farrell impressed by 'very pleasing' win over Fiji

articles.description: Leicester City boss Steve Cooper is highly critical of referee Andy Madley after his side's 2-1 defeat by Chelsea.
articles.title: Leicester City boss Steve Cooper criticises referee Andrew Madley

articles.description: England's Charley Hull cards a second consecutive 66 to move four shots behind the leaders going into the final round of the CME Group Tour Championship.
articles.title: England's Charley Hull four shots off lead after third round at LPGA finale
